title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement kanwals@unimelb.edu.au. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to RNAsum

title: Contributing to RNAsum
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to RNAsum
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See tidyverse guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to RNAsum
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("umccr/RNAsum", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to RNAsum
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to RNAsum
text: Please note RNAsum project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: RNAsum Sections
text: Fusion genes detected transcriptome data prioritised based criteria ranked following order: Involvement fusion gene(s) detected genomic data (Structural variants results available) Detected transcriptome data arriba Reported fusion event according FusionGDB database Decreasing number split reads Decreasing number pair reads Involvement cancer gene(s) (see Cancer genes section)

title: RNAsum Sections
text: Fusion genes detected transcriptome data reported least one following criteria met: Involvement fusion gene(s) detected genomic data (SV results available) Reported fusion event according FusionGDB database Involvement cancer gene(s) (see Cancer genes section) Split reads > 1 Pair reads > 1 split reads > 1

title: Workflow Details
text: Check PCGR tiered TSV output file available (e.g. ). Extract expression level information genome-based findings genes detected genomic variants (use --pcgr_tier argument define tier threshold value). Order genes increasing variant tier decreasing absolute values representing difference expression levels patient sample corresponding reference cohort.

title: Workflow Details
text: Check Manta annotated TSV output file available (e.g. example input). Extract expression level information genome-based findings genes located within detected SVs Order genes increasing SV score decreasing absolute values representing difference expression levels patient sample corresponding reference cohort. Compare gene fusions detected WTS data (arriba pizzly) WGS data (Manta) Prioritise WGS-supported gene fusions.

title: Workflow Details
text: Check PURPLE output file available (e.g. example input). Extract expression level information genome-based findings genes located within detected CNVs (use --cn_loss --cn_gain arguments define CN threshold values classify genes within lost gained regions). Order genes increasing (genes within lost regions) decreasing (genes within gained regions) Copy Number decreasing absolute values representing difference expression levels patient sample corresponding reference cohort.

code: remotes::install_github("umccr/RNAsum") # latest main commit remotes::install_github("umccr/RNAsum@v0.0.X") # version 0.0.X remotes::install_github("umccr/RNAsum@abcde") # commit abcde remotes::install_github("umccr/RNAsum#123") # PR 123 conda install r-rnasum==0.0.X -c umccr -c conda-forge -c bioconda docker pull ghcr.io/umccr/rnasum:latest

title: A Robust Tool for Performing Transcriptome Profiling on Cancer Data
text: pipeline consists five main components illustrated briefly described . details, see workflow.md.  Collect patient WTS data DRAGEN RNA pipeline including per-gene read counts gene fusions. Add expression data reference cohorts get idea expression levels genes interest cancer patient cohorts. read counts normalised, transformed converted scale allows present patient’s expression measurements context reference cohorts. Supply genome-based findings whole-genome sequencing (WGS) data focus genes interest provide additional evidence dysregulation mutated genes, genes located within detected structural variants (SVs) copy-number (CN) altered regions. RNAsum designed compatible WGS patient outputs generated umccrise. Collate results knowledge derived -house resources public databases provide additional sources evidence clinical significance altered genes e.g. flag variants clinical significance potential druggable targets. final product interactive HTML report searchable tables plots presenting expression levels genes interest. report consists several sections described .

Depending tissue patient’s sample taken, one 33 cancer datasets TCGA can used reference cohort comparing expression changes genes interest patient. Additionally, 10 samples 33 TCGA datasets combined create Pan-Cancer dataset, cohorts extended sets also available. available datasets listed TCGA projects summary table. datasets processed using methods described TCGA-data-harmonization repository. dataset interest can specified using one TCGA project IDs RNAsum --dataset argument (see Examples).

title: A Robust Tool for Performing Transcriptome Profiling on Cancer Data
text: publicly available TCGA datasets expected demonstrate prominent batch effects compared -house WTS data due differences applied experimental procedures analytical pipelines. Moreover, TCGA data may include samples tissue material lower quality cellularity compared samples processed using local protocols. address issues, built high-quality internal reference cohort processed using pipelines input data (see data pre-processing). internal reference set 40 pancreatic cancer samples based WTS data generated UMCCR processed bcbio-nextgen RNA-seq pipeline minimise potential batch effects investigated samples reference cohort make sure data comparable. internal reference cohort assembly summarised Pancreatic-data-harmonization repository. Note two rationales using internal reference cohort: batch effects correction reference point comparing per-gene expression levels observed data patient interest data pancreatic cancer patients. case samples cancer type data internal reference cohort used batch effects correction procedure performed minimise technical-related variation data.

Additionally, WTS data can integrated WGS-based data processed using tools discussed section WGS. latter case, genome-based findings corresponding sample incorporated report used primary source expression profile prioritisation.

title: A Robust Tool for Performing Transcriptome Profiling on Cancer Data
text: Note Human reference genome GRCh38 (Ensembl based annotation version 105) used gene annotation default. GRCh37 longer supported.
code: rnasum_cli=$(Rscript -e 'x = system.file("cli", package = "RNAsum"); cat(x, "\n")' | xargs) export PATH="${rnasum_cli}:${PATH}" $ rnasum.R --version 1.1.0   $ rnasum.R --help Usage =====   /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.2/Resources/library/RNAsum/cli/rnasum.R [options]   Options ======= --arriba_dir=ARRIBA_DIR         Directory path to Arriba results containing fusions.pdf and fusions.tsv.  --arriba_pdf=ARRIBA_PDF         File path of Arriba PDF output.  --arriba_tsv=ARRIBA_TSV         File path of Arriba TSV output.  --batch_rm         Remove batch-associated effects between datasets.  --cn_gain=CN_GAIN         CN threshold value to classify genes within gained regions. [def: 95]  --cn_loss=CN_LOSS         CN threshold value to classify genes within lost regions. [def: 5]  --dataset=DATASET         Dataset to be used as external reference cohort. [def: PANCAN]  --dataset_name_incl         Include dataset in report name.  --dragen_fusions=DRAGEN_FUSIONS         File path to DRAGEN RNA-seq 'fusion_candidates.final' output.  --dragen_mapping_metrics=DRAGEN_MAPPING_METRICS         File path to DRAGEN RNA-seq 'mapping_metrics.csv' output.  --dragen_wts_dir=DRAGEN_WTS_DIR         Directory path to DRAGEN RNA-seq results.  --drugs         Include drug matching section in report.  --filter         Filter out low expressed genes.  --immunogram         Include immunogram in report.  --log         Log2 transform data before normalisation.  --manta_tsv=MANTA_TSV         File path to umccrise 'manta.tsv' output.  --norm=NORM         Normalisation method.  --pcgr_splice_vars         Include non-coding splice region variants reported in PCGR.  --pcgr_tier=PCGR_TIER         Tier threshold for reporting variants reported in PCGR. [def: 4]  --pcgr_tiers_tsv=PCGR_TIERS_TSV         File path to PCGR 'snvs_indels.tiers.tsv' output.  --project=PROJECT         Project name, used for annotation purposes only.  --purple_gene_tsv=PURPLE_GENE_TSV         File path to PURPLE 'purple.cnv.gene.tsv' output.  --report_dir=REPORT_DIR         Directory path to output report.  --salmon=SALMON         File path to salmon 'quant.genes.sf' output.  --sample_name=SAMPLE_NAME         Sample name to be presented in report.  --sample_source=SAMPLE_SOURCE         Type of investigated sample. [def: -]  --save_tables         Save interactive summary tables as HTML.  --scaling=SCALING         Scaling for z-score transformation (gene-wise or group-wise). [def: gene-wise]  --subject_id=SUBJECT_ID         Subject ID.  --top_genes=TOP_GENES         Number of top ranked genes to be presented in report.  --transform=TRANSFORM         Transformation method to be used when converting read counts. [def: CPM]  --umccrise=UMCCRISE         Directory path of the corresponding WGS-related umccrise data.  --version, -v         Print RNAsum version and exit.  --help, -h         Show this help message and exit

title: A Robust Tool for Performing Transcriptome Profiling on Cancer Data

title: Read Arriba PDF File — arriba_pdf_read
code: pdf <- system.file("rawdata/test_data/dragen/arriba/fusions.pdf", package = "RNAsum") tsv <- system.file("rawdata/test_data/dragen/arriba/fusions.tsv", package = "RNAsum") fusions <- arriba_tsv_read(tsv) (pngs <- arriba_pdf_read(pdf, fusions, tempdir())) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   nm                                                                 png         #>   <chr>                                                              <chr>       #> 1 EP300.AS1__XRCC6_chr22.41195482_chr22.41636113                     /tmp/Rtmpy… #> 2 LAPTM4A__AC098828.3_chr2.20051410_chr2.20064511                    /tmp/Rtmpy… #> 3 FNIP1__AC112492.1.83716..DCAF8L1.218._chr5.131642783_chrX.27977775 /tmp/Rtmpy… #> 4 ZFP64__MORC2_chr20.52096811_chr22.30963497                         /tmp/Rtmpy…

title: Read WGS Data — read_wgs_data
text: list input sample data.

title: Read WGS Data — read_wgs_data
code: p <- list(   umccrise = system.file("rawdata/test_data/umccrised/test_sample_WGS", package = "RNAsum"),   pcgr_tiers_tsv = system.file(     "rawdata/test_data/umccrised/test_sample_WGS/small_variants",     "TEST-somatic.pcgr.snvs_indels.tiers.tsv",     package = "RNAsum"   ),   manta_tsv = system.file(     "rawdata/test_data/umccrised/test_sample_WGS/structural/TEST-prioritize-manta.tsv",     package = "RNAsum"   ) ) (res <- read_wgs_data(p)) #> $pcgr_tiers_tsv #> # A tibble: 99 × 61 #>    CHROM POS       REF   ALT   GENOMIC_CHANGE    GENOME_VERSION VCF_SAMPLE_ID    #>    <chr> <chr>     <chr> <chr> <chr>             <chr>          <chr>            #>  1 3     179218303 G     A     3:g.179218303G>A  grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  2 17    7674894   G     A     17:g.7674894G>A   grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  3 13    110715614 C     G     13:g.110715614C>G grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  4 13    110719444 G     C     13:g.110719444G>C grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  5 8     20250093  C     T     8:g.20250093C>T   grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  6 8     13086457  C     T     8:g.13086457C>T   grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  7 10    31521795  G     C     10:g.31521795G>C  grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  8 9     132927250 G     A     9:g.132927250G>A  grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #>  9 3     47121452  G     A     3:g.47121452G>A   grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #> 10 6     117365075 G     C     6:g.117365075G>C  grch38         SBJ02999__PRJ22… #> # title: Generate UMCCR RNAsum Report — rnasum_rmd
text: Generates UMCCR RNAsum HTML report. following steps: copy rmd tmp/rnasum.Rmd render rmd inside tmp/ return path output HTML

title: Generate UMCCR RNAsum Report — rnasum_rmd
text: out_file Path output HTML file (needs '.html' suffix). quiet Suppress printing rendering. pars List named parameters override custom params specified within Rmd's YAML front-matter.

title: Generate UMCCR RNAsum Report — rnasum_rmd
text: Path rendered HTML report.

title: Get Salmon Counts — salmon_counts
text: Get salmon counts via tximport.

title: Get Salmon Counts — salmon_counts
text: x Path quant.sf quant.genes.sf file abundances. See tximport::tximport. tx2gene data.frame tx_name gene_id columns. See tximport::tximport.

title: Get Salmon Counts — salmon_counts
text: Tibble counts per gene transcript, NULL input params NULL.

title: Get Salmon Counts — salmon_counts
code: x <- system.file("rawdata/test_data/dragen/TEST.quant.sf", package = "RNAsum") tx2gene <- NULL (sc <- salmon_counts(x, tx2gene)) # NULL since no tx2gene specified #> NULL

what: Wrapper for saveWidget bug fix — saveWidgetFix
title: Wrapper for saveWidget bug fix — saveWidgetFix
text: wrapper saveWidget compensates bug temporary directory widget dependencies deleted - see https://github.com/ramnathv/htmlwidgets/issues/296.

title: Wrapper for saveWidget bug fix — saveWidgetFix
Wrapper for saveWidget bug fix — saveWidgetFix
text: widget Widget save. file Full path save HTML . selfcontained Whether save HTML single self-contained file (external resources base64 encoded) file external resources placed adjacent directory. ... Additional arguments passed htmlwidgets::saveWidget.

title: Wrapper for saveWidget bug fix — saveWidgetFix
text: Change work dir compensate saveWidget bug

what: Generate spider web plots to present immunogram genes — webplot
title: Generate spider web plots to present immunogram genes — webplot
text: Generate spider web plots present immunogram genes (http://www.statisticstoproveanything.com/2013/11/spider-web-plots--r.html).

title: Generate spider web plots to present immunogram genes — webplot
code: webplot(   data,   data.row = NULL,   y.cols = NULL,   main = NULL,   add = F,   col = "red",   lty = 1,   scale = T )

title: Generate spider web plots to present immunogram genes — webplot
text: data Dataframe matrix. data.row Row data plot (NULL uses row 1). y.cols Columns interest (NULL selects numeric columns). main Title plot (NULL rowname data). add Whether plot added existing plot. col Color data line lty Lty data line scale Scale.

title: Generate spider web plots to present immunogram genes — webplot
text: Spider web plots present immunogram genes
